sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"妒忌"之意。
means: envy ： 侧重指因别人获得了自己本想获得的东西或成就而产生妒忌。
jealousy ： 强调对别人占有的东西恼恨不满。

word_mean: 妒忌，羡慕：希冀取得他人所具事物或品格的强烈愿望

sentence.Network_en: Unconscious envy manifests itself very often as this kind of arrogance.
sentence.Network_cn: 潜意识里的嫉妒常表现为这种傲慢自大。

sentence.Network_en: Glover thinks that Smith did him down, perhaps out of envy.
sentence.Network_cn: 格洛弗认为史密斯说他坏话，也许是出于嫉妒。

sentence.Network_en: Gradually he began to acknowledge his feelings of envy towards his mother.
sentence.Network_cn: 渐渐地，他开始承认自己羡慕母亲。

...997)指出，心理学家就在此种心态下，使心理学界由物理羡妒(physics envy)而衍生了牛顿幻想(Newtonian fantasy)[13]；幻想心理学 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the sense 'hostility, enmity'): from Old French envie (noun), envier (verb), from Latin invidia, from invidere 'regard maliciously, grudge', from in- 'into' + videre 'to see'

encyclopedia.content: 字典解释 Envy，意为嫉妒，是圣经里七原罪之一。 envy KK: [] DJ: [] n. ⒈ 妒忌；羡慕[(+at/of/towards)] She said it out of envy. 她出于嫉妒说了这话。 ⒉ 妒忌的对象；羡慕的目标[the S][(+of)] His talent is the envy of his colleagues. 他的同事都羡慕他的才能。 vt. ⒈ 妒忌；羡慕[O1] I envy you your good luck. 我羡慕你的好运。 以上结果由 Dr.eye译典通字典 提供 圣经七原罪 圣经中的七原罪之一 骄傲（Pride） 嫉

entry.def: Envy is the feeling you have when you wish you could have the same thing or quality that someone else has.

example.ex: Gradually he began to acknowledge his feelings of envy towards his mother...
example.tran: 渐渐地，他开始承认自己羡慕母亲。

example.ex: They gazed in a mixture of envy and admiration at the beauty of the statue.
example.tran: 他们心情复杂地凝视着这尊雕像，既为它的美丽折服又心生忌妒。

entry.def: If you envy someone, you wish that you had the same things or qualities that they have.

example.ex: I don't envy the young ones who've become TV superstars and know no other world...
example.tran: 我不羡慕那些成为超级电视明星，对其他却一无所知的年轻人。

example.ex: I have a rich brother and a lot of people envy the fact...
example.tran: 我有个有钱的兄弟，很多人都因此羡慕我。

entry.tran: 羡慕的对象；令人忌妒的特征
entry.def: If a thing or quality is the envy of someone, they wish very much that they could have or achieve it.

example.ex: Britain is now the envy of the world's record companies.
example.tran: 英国现在是全世界唱片公司羡慕的对象。

example.ex: ...an economic expansion that was the envy of many other states.
example.tran: 令很多其他国家羡慕的经济发展

means.word_mean: 1. a feeling of grudging admiration and desire to have something possessed by another
2. spite and resentment at seeing the success of another (personified as one of the deadly sins)
2. be envious of; set one's heart on

auth_sentence.content: But thanks god I am not green with envy.
auth_sentence.res_content: But thanks god I am not green with envy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But thanks god I am not green with envy.

auth_sentence.content: Narcissism can be reinforced as a defence against envy.
auth_sentence.res_content: Narcissism can be reinforced as a defence against envy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Narcissism can be reinforced as a defence against envy.

auth_sentence.content: The thick venom of envy began squirting at me.
auth_sentence.res_content: The thick venom of envy began squirting at me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The thick venom of envy began squirting at me.

stems_affixes.word_buile: view看,查→观察, 观看→风景
inter在……之间+view看,查→n.&v.接见, 会见
sur在……上面+vey=view看,查→在上面看,从上往下看→俯瞰→测量,调查
view看,查→观察, 观看→风景

Sentence.sentence: The man's unique talents are the envy of many people.
That was partly due to his talents: showmanship, strategic vision, an astonishing attention to detail and a dictatorial management style which many bosses must have envied.

sentences.en: They were full of envy when they saw my new car.
sentences.cn: 他们看了我的新汽车, 都非常羡慕。

sentences.en: I envy your ability to work so fast.
sentences.cn: 我真羡慕你, 能干得这么快。

sentences.en: I don't envy your journey in this bad weather.
sentences.cn: 我才不羡慕你在这样恶劣的天气里旅行呢。

jushi.english: His new house excited their envy.
jushi.chinese: 他们很羡慕他的新房子。

jushi.english: I couldn't conceal my envy at his success.
jushi.chinese: 我掩饰不住对他成就的嫉妒。

jushi.english: They were full of envy when they saw my new car.
jushi.chinese: 他们看了我的新汽车都非常羡慕。
